body:
### Rationale

I think we can improve usability slightly by printing the activation command of an environment after `spack env create` to the terminal. I find myself often creating and then forgettting to immediately activate an environment.

### Description

See Spack's workflow:
```console
$ spack env create test123
==> Updating view at /home/axel/src/spack/var/spack/environments/test123/.spack-env/view
==> Created environment 'test123' in /home/axel/src/spack/var/spack/environments/test123
```

versus Conda's workflow:
```console
$ conda create -y -n test123
# ... verbose bla bla ...

# To activate this environment, use
#     $ conda activate test123
# To deactivate an active environment, use
#     $ conda deactivate
```


### Additional information

Additionally, we could add a `--activate|-a` flag to `env create` to do it in one go.
title: spack env create: show activation
